headline: Jeff's Hot Dog Chili
description: A hot dog chili recipe made with ground beef, spices, and no beans that's ready in 30 minutes. Serve over a hot dog in a bun for an easy family meal!

video.description: Treat yourself to some chili dog nostalgia with this terrific topper!
video.name: Jeff's Hot Dog Chili

name: Jeff's Hot Dog Chili

recipeInstructions.text: Place ground beef and water in a large saucepan; use a potato masher to break apart beef.
Stir in tomato sauce, ketchup, chili powder, salt, black pepper, sugar, onion powder, and Worcestershire sauce.
Bring to a boil, then simmer over medium heat until beef is cooked and chili thickens, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: The flavor was pretty good I did add some garlic powder, red pepper flakes to taste, I did not drain it even though I knew I should have. It was so greasy following the recipe but I saved it at the end drained most of the grease off.. also it is a little runny if you want it thicker add tomato paste a little at a time until you get the consistency you like. my advice though cook the burger first drain it then put all in the pot to simmer for the 20 mins and you will have a decent, fast hotdog chili I tried this one because I didn't have any fresh onions or peppers on hand that I do with my version.. just had spices on hand today.
Great chili‚Ä¶ can use as sloppy also
Best hotdog chili I‚Äôve tried! Make it every year for a big organization cookout. Thanks for the recipe!
Did not really like this. I'm from Texas and we don't use ketchup in chili. I added some cumin and garlic powder to try and make it taste like I like it but it didn't work. Won't make again.
I put this chili on fries with cheese and my kids devoured it!

I make this yummy recipe X 20! The nonprofit organization, that my son in law started about 10 months ago, feed our homeless friends, in our area, one Saturday a month. Over the summer, we have served chili cheese hot dogs and nachos. This is a favorite for many. Thank you, for this simple recipe, that can be used to help others! Renee
I added an onion, chopped and cooked with the meat.
The recipe was simple and turned out well. I made a few changes by adding garlic powder, a touch of hot sauce and a little more chili powder. Overall, I would make it again.
Nice recipe. Left out the sugar and added cumin. Very good. Thanks.

Just made this last night. I followed the recipe exactly except that I fried the ground beef first and then added the sauce and spices. I let it cook down for about 20-25 min. It was delicious! Perfect hot dog chili or even alone on a bun. We will definitely be having this again!
I used ground turkey in stead of ground beef!! Awesome

Love it! Sometimes recipes go a step too far in an effort to upgrade or "fancy it up". This one is just right! Its just simple hot dog chili. I've made both beef and turkey and they both good. Its so easy, you can't mess it up.

Have been making this for several years. If you like your chili a bit on the sweet side (as I do), this is the recipe for you, I add a half teaspoon of garlic salt. Always awesome on a dog with a cold beer!
I make this every time we have hotdogs and also chili cheese fries. Sometimes I put extra hot sauce to give it a little more spice. My go to hotdog chili.
I stayed with the recipe and didn't change anything. Everyone loves it!!
It was fantastic and is now a family favorite

This recipe reminded me of eating hotdogs with chili at the baseball field growing up! I can‚Äôt have hotdogs now without making this delicious simple recipe to go on top. My buddies have all raved about it and love it!
Very accurate and spot on, but if you want more of an old fashioned grandma and grandpa's chili....add a smidgen of cinnamon, brown sugar, and a shake of himmilaian salt! üòâ
Don‚Äôt change a thing! It‚Äôs perfect! So much better than canned, and no chemicals! üëçüèª

First off don't add any sugar! I used Sriracha ketchup and added a tbsp of tomato paste I used 8 oz of unsalted tomato sauce and 4 oz of hatch green chili hot diced. Substitute the water for 2/3 cup beef broth. This recipe is amazing I love it and mad props to Jeff!
It's a very good recipe. I will be using this recipe from now on except I will add less chili powder as we aren't fans of very spicy foods. Thank you for sharing the recipe!

Recipe was good . I cooked my hamburger meat to almost done so I could drain the grease / blood out ,before I added everything else cooked the same time to get the sauce thicker more sauce then expected think next time I will do it the same but add more hamburger maybe haft to a pound

Great on it's own, awsome if you find what it's "missing". Flavourful is personal preference, for me it was missing Trinidad scorpion pepper and a small splash of black coffee left over from breakfast. I know it sounds weird, but I always put a splash of cold coffee in anything chili flavored while it's cooking.
The BEST chili dog recipe
Loved the recipe as is, but now I mince up some onion to go into it.

I made as written, with 2 changes, no sugar added, because I used Whataburger Ketchup that is incredibly sweet, and I just forgot the dash of Worcestershire sauce. But we didn't miss it. Family gave thumbs up approval and very proud of how it turned out, and so easy. Glad I watched the video how-to.
Delicious! It was the perfect texture. I added a little spice and used chili sauce instead of ketchup.
I think I‚Äôll cook the burger first drain it then follow the directions mine came out greasy

I honestly love this recipe and so did my family! I did make a few changes to suit my taste, such as increasing the amount of Worcestershire sauce and chili powder and adding garlic and garlic powder, mustard, American cheese, and smoked paprika, but this recipe was a great starting point. Thank you for sharing!

I discovered this recipe a couple of years ago. It is now my go to hot dog chili recipe, usually making a couple of 5# batches each camping season. I‚Äôve made a few minor changes, like using cumin and ancho chili powder. I also use too much water in the beginning and drain some off to trap some grease. 
Easily coverts to a chili and a wonderful spaghetti sauce as well. Always a crowd favorite.
Greaaat!!!! I just cut down the seasonal to 1/4 due to high blood pressure. It tastes great

This hot dog chili is absolutely fantastic!!! I didn't add the sugar, the ketchup makes it sweet enough for my taste. Has just a little bit of a kick. I used 93% lean ground beef so it wasn't greasy. Did not drain. Freeze the leftovers for next time. Jeff, awesome.
Thank you so much for sharing this recipe , I have tried for years to find a good hotdog chili recipe I have to say this one is amazing I will be making it again
I found the recipe good just the way it was submitted. Will make again!
good recipe! I added cheese melt
Amazing! I should have drained the meat before I added the ingredients, it turned out watery so I had to drain most of it but it tastes so good!!

Wow! This turned out great. Made it as is minus the extra sugar and it was perfect. It was super easy to make with pantry staples and tastes so much better than the canned stuff. Our hot dog extravaganza is going to be a hit tomorrow. Thank you!!

Made as written. I used 85% beef and somehow it wasn‚Äôt greasy! Nathan‚Äôs jumbo hot dog and creamy slaw and I‚Äôm back in North Carolina. Family loved it, 1son asked for a little spice. Maybe add rotel next time. Thanks for a great recipe!

all I can say is this is a must try!!! coming from a person who rarely comments on blogs or post. this recipe was amazing!! as some have stated they had to make changes, nothing major. I omitted the sugar as this was already sweetened with the ketchup. I added two tbs of tomato paste, chopped pimento seeds, garlic powder and mustard. I'm crying my way to the gym because this just earned itself a place on my menu at least 3-4 times a year.
Great.
This is a really easy hot dog chili sauce. Very tasty and quick to make.

Great recipe! See my pic testing it on a chip with sour cream, yum! BUT, it is quite greasy. I‚Äôm all for fatty food, but this would result in heartburn even for my solid stomach. I spooned out a quarter-cup of grease on a double recipe, 85-15 ground beef.

Just like the traditional chili for Carolina Hot Dogs! I have tried many recipes over the years. This is the best. Best flavor, best consistency, and best texture so far. All I need now is a bun, a frank, mustard, chopped onions, and coleslaw to put under the chili. Can‚Äôt wait.
Great but used his ingredients to my taste. Tripled spices

YUMMY!

I took some advice from a few other reviews and it turned out just how I was wanting!

1) I used beef broth instead of water and increased it a bit because...

2) I used tomato paste instead of sauce

3) I added garlic powder because, well, I don't make much without garlic

The consistency is perfect when the ground beef warms at room temp for a bit, then is stirred with the rest of the ingredients before cooked through. I used chuck so it wasn't greasy at all.

I'm sorry...just no. We all have different tastes, but this was so ketchupy I couldn't eat it on a hot dog. I tried everything. More chili powder, garlic, apple cider vinegar, cumin, more water, more tomato sauce but nothing would cut that ketchup taste. I would never eat ketchup on a hot dog, anyway, so this was DEFINITELY not for me. It was also very salty.
Easy to make but tastes more like sloppy joes than hot dogs. Would def make again for sloppy joes tho

very disappointed. Followed directions exactly. All it did was make a tasty sloppy joes mix. Hot dog chili it's not. However, if your looking to make a pretty good sloppy joe's from scratch, then this is it! 
Sorry, I was expecting a coney island style chili.
I have made this numerous times and finally found a minute to write a review . Love it
This chili sauce is so dang good. The only thing I did different was add 1/2 tsp more chili powder. Taste just like what mom used to make.
Made this several times over the past few years.

Made this last minute for a quick chili dog dinner. I was looking for a hot dog chili similar to our Varsity chili dogs‚Äô in Atlanta. This wasn‚Äôt exact but was very good so I‚Äôm definitely saving it! I made it to the letter since it was a first try and the only thing I‚Äôd change would be to leave out the sugar. I think the ketchup has plenty. For those saying it was runny, I worried about that too, but boiled the heck out of it on medium for about 25 minutes and it was perfect. I did blot the top to get some of the grease out - not sure how to avoid that & get the right consistency. Using the potato masher worked great. My husband gobbled his chili dogs up - success!!
DELICIOUS!!!!!

This was so good that it was requested I make it twice this week! We had it once with chili dogs (for that one I used half the meat but still the same sauce), and we'll have it tonight with some spicy cheddar biscuits we got from our neighbors. It's delicious! I didn't have any issues with it being runny, even using half the meat. I just simmered it until it was thick enough. OH I did omit the sugar. I'm sure it would taste just fine with it, I just try to eat fairly low carb so the amount of sugar in the ketchup is just fine for me.
This is a perfect hot dog sauce!
Is not a chili flavor at all. taste like sloppy joe mix. very disappointed
Unexpected method, excellent results. Many thanks for this recipe! I might use less water next time, but am otherwise happy with the recipe as-written.
Thank you!!! Was the quickest, easiest, best tasting chili I‚Äôve ever made!!!! Just like I wanted for frito pies, hot dogs, and baked potatoes
Good,put hbg in food chopper after cooking to make really fine
Perfect! This is the one I have been searching for years!
Great! We like ours with some zip so added a little cayenne pepper powder! Keeper!
It was a hit at our gathering!
Best hotdog chili I‚Äôve ever had. Ever. The only thing I changed was I added a little chopped onion. Will be the only chili recipe I ever use. Thanks so much!
I added some tomato paste and it came out great
This is delicious! I did brown and drain the hamburger first but then followed to the letter. I can see lots of ways to change it up but wanted to review the actual recipe. Will make it again.
Work out real good for I slow cook until got moisture I wanted and taste I was looking for
It was like it was only ketchup that was the only thing I tasted me and my mom tried to put more thing in it like chicken broth but it did not work not going to use this recipe no more
I like a thicker chili, so I didn‚Äôt add water & I used tomato paste. I just dashed it with a little more Worcestershire sauce a few times to make it smoother. Great flavor!!

I'll never buy canned hot dog chili again! I made the mistake of browning the ground beef first, because I didn't pay attention to the directions, but it still turned out great and I had the benefit of draining the grease off the browned meat. Will be making it again!

Fantastic recipe. I did sub tomato sauce for the ketchup the recipe called for and leave out the small amount of sugar, but otherwise it was unchanged. Truly the best homemade hot dog chili I‚Äôve ever had.

I made it exactly as the recipe said. At first I thought it was strange cooking meat in water but it turned it into a beautiful texture. I used 85% chop meat and cooked it in the water and it was pretty good. If you used 80% chop meat I think it would be too oily. 
I loved how you could change the quantity of the ingredients depending on how much you want to make, it made it so simple.
Wonderful recipe I'll be making it again.

I used this as a base, doubled meat, added 1.5 chopped onions to meat and cooked together, then drained. Added 1 can tomato sauce and 1 can hunts diced tomato‚Äôs medium chili style. Doubled all ingredients, didn‚Äôt add any sugar. Added extra Worcestershire and chili powder to taste. Loved it.
I cut the ketchup in half and added salsa instead. And used ground turkey. Turned out pretty good. Perfect for chili cheese fries.
Just like my mama makes
The only thing I did different was I added some chopped onion to the ground beef and browned it then drained the fat before I added the rest of the ingredients. It turned out great
We made it for my daughter's wedding reception in the woods. It was a HIT!
I recommend straining out the water after cooking the meat
This was very good.
good basic hot dog chili recipe. i vary it depending on what i have on hand :)

I make this chili, as it was my grandmother's recipe. Hers/mine is a tad different. I use brown sugar rather than white. I don't use tomato sauce. I don't use worcestershire and I DO use about 2 t of yellow mustard.
Excellent! Followed recipe almost exactly just changed water to beef broth. Great chili dog!
Excellent! Followed recipe almost exactly just changed water to beef broth. Great chili dog!
Delicious and easy to make!
Too sweet even with omitting the sugar. Taste like sloppy joes. Hope to find a Savory recipe not sweet.
I liked this, but It didn't remind me of the sauce I grew up in WV with though. That was what I was really looking for. This is a very good alternative.
Loved it husband loved it

I so wanted to love this after reading the reviews, but sadly, it was not what I was expecting. Followed recipe exactly and it tasted like Manwich! Took it to work for a hot dog event, and everyone who tried it agreed it tasted like sloppy joes. Nothing against sloppy joes, but I wanted a hot dog chili and this just is not it!
So good, just like my mother use to make us as kids here in the Mountains of NC

STICK TO THE RECIPE, at least for the first time. I've made this twice. The first time I listened to the suggestions in the comments and it was ok, the second time I followed the directions and it came out much better.

Browning the beef changed the consistency, it made it much more clumpy and dry so use lean beef and don't brown/drain. I also used beef broth which overwhelmed the other flavors instead of the water which would bring out the flavor of the spices.I ended up with something closer to Taco Bell ground beef both in flavor and consistency. It wasn't bad, just not what I wanted.

The second time I followed the directions exactly and it came out much tastier and with a more sloppy consistency.
The original recipe was too sweet for our families liking, so I made the following adjustments: I added 1 tsp of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of cayenne pepper and 1 can of Stags chilli.
Very good recipe. I browned the meat and drained it before following the directions. Would recommend!

I had to come change my rating. Initially, I wasn't impressed, but maybe it was too hot to get a good taste. ;-) My teen gives it 4.5 stars; hubby 4; my little one doesn't understand the rating system. Personally, I'd give it a good 4-ish (plus) rating. Thanks, Jeff, for a good recipe! It seems I'll be making this again, after all. :-)
My husband is from Detroit...home of the Coney Dogs....he is extremely picky and he loved this! It was a family hit. I used all beef hotdogs and very lean hamburger meat.

I added 1 tsp A1 sauce 
 1 tsp brown sugar

we loved it will make again and again

Perfect with some modifications! Use 85/15 ground beef. Do not brown the beef first, it all cooks together. Use 1 full 8oz can of tomato sauce (the small size can). DO NOT exceed 1/2 tsp of sugar - it goes a long ways in this recipe.
Great recipe. I made as is. Just what I was looking for!

Made this for a cookout and everyone loved it! I even sent some leftover chili home with friends. It reminds me of the chili they served at a Mom & Pop hotdog place where I grew up and that's a great thing. 
The only changes I made were to use chicken broth instead of water and to sub some of the ketchup with pizza sauce I had on hand. I overestimated how much ketchup I had and only had about a 1/4 cup.
We served the hot dogs with chili, shredded cheese, minced onion, dill relish, and sauerkraut.
Delicious!! Even better the next day!!
I made this because I forgot to buy canned chili, well needles to say I don't think I'll ever buy another can of chili! This is my go to chili now, thanks so much!
